entry.title: Russian rejoins grain export deal with Ukraine
entry.summary:
Russia has decided to rejoin the Black Sea grain deal as Moscow ramps up their attacks on Ukraine's energy facilities.
Under the agreement, Ukraine had been able to restart grain and fertiliser exports which had stalled due to the ongoing war with Russia.
Russia had previously suspended its participation in the deal after a drone attack on its warships.

entry.title: Early Coal Retirement: How about a Global Auction
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON DC, Nov 02 (IPS) - Report after report highlights that we can only achieve the greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reductions required by the climate goals of the Paris Agreement if much of the existing coal power generation capacity is retired early.Â  To this end, one concept that deserves greater consideration is conducting an auction for early retirement of coal power plants worldwide: a global coal retirement auction. This article sets out the broad outlines of how this global auction might operate.

entry.title: Tackling Recurring Hunger Crises at the Horn of Africa - Beginning with Somalia
entry.summary:
URBANA, Illinois, USA, Nov 02 (IPS) - The statistics are stark. The crisis is unprecedented. Yet again, according to the United Nations, famine looms in Somalia, with hundreds of thousands already facing starvation. In addition, droughts, and catastrophic hunger levels have left over 500,000 children malnourished and at risk of dying. This is already nearly 200,000 more than the 2011 famine. Urgent immediate actions must be taken now, both to address the crisis in the short-term and long-term.

Read the full story, â€œTackling Recurring Hunger Crises at the Horn of Africa - Beginning with Somaliaâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: Forbidden Stories founder on continuing the work of silenced journalists
entry.summary: French journalist Laurent Richard founded Forbidden Stories in 2017 with a simple mission: to continue the work of journalists who have been assassinated or otherwise silenced. That same year, Maltese journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia was killed in a car bomb. The organisation worked to continue her investigations and identify her killers, exposing corruption at the highest levels of the Maltese government. For Richard,Â theÂ ultimateÂ goal of Forbidden Stories is twofold: to bring crucial reporting to the world and to deter crimes against journalists by showing that "it doesn't make sense to kill a reporter when there are 50 others ready to carry on their work". He joined us for Perspective as we mark the International Day to End Impunity for Crimes Against Journalists.

entry.title: Haiti faces gang violence, assassinations, shortages of food and fuel
entry.summary: Haiti has been grappling with myriad crises that have spread across the nation over the last month. Widespread gasoline and diesel shortages have emerged after armed gangs blocked the nation's main fuel terminal, and these gangs have also severed access to clean water, food and other essentials as Haiti also deals with a deadly cholera outbreak. Amy Wilentz, author of "The Rainy Season: Haiti Since Duvalier" and a professor of literary journalism at the University of California, Irvine, joined CBS News to discuss.

entry.title: Exit Polls Show No Clear Winner In Denmark Election
entry.summary: DW: Denmark: No clear winner, ex-PM to play key role â€” exit pollÂ Former Prime Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen is set to play a pivotal role after an inconclusive election result, exit polls have revealed.Â Neither the ruling left nor the right-wing opposition are set to win a majority.Â Former Danish Prime Minister Lars Lokke Rasmussen looked set to become the Scandinavian country's proverbial kingmaker after an inconclusive election result, according to exit polls on Tuesday, with neither the ruling left nor right-wing opposition set to secure enough seats. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: It looks like Denmark's ruling centre-left coalition have lost their majority. Final results will be known in the next few days.Â Exit Polls Show No Clear Winner In Denmark Election Â Exit poll points to no clear winner in Danish election -- AP Â Exit polls show no clear winning majority in Denmark election -- France 24 Â Denmark election: Social Democrats lead but no majority, exit poll suggests -- The Guardian Â Danish vote paves way for centrist government: exit poll -- Politico

entry.title: Israeli Exit Polls Put Netanyahu's Party On Course To Form The Next Government
entry.summary:
DW: Israel election: Exit polls put Netanyahu's party aheadÂ Exit polls show ex-premier Benjamin Netanyahu's party securing the most seats in parliament.Â It's Israel's fifth national election since 2019. Former Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his right-wing allies secured an early lead in Israel's latest national election, according to exit polls released on Tuesday night after voting closed.Â Exit polls published by Israeli broadcasters showed former Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud party and allied parties close to securing a majority in the 120-seat Knesset. Â Read more ....Â WNU Editor: Netanyahu is no friend of the Biden White House. He has also vowed to undo the US brokered maritime deal with Lebanon. It looks like there is going to be a lot of friction between the U.S. and Israel.
Israeli Exit Polls Put Netanyahu's Party On Course To Form The Next Government Â Israeli election: Exit polls point to Netanyahu win -- AP Â Netanyahu poised for comeback in Israel election, initial projections show -- France 24 Israel elections: Netanyahu in lead, exit polls say -- BBC Â Israeli elections: Early exit polls show Netanyahu's bloc winning narrow majority -- Axios Â Israel election: Early exit polls show Netanyahu poised to return to power -- FOX News Â Netanyahu poised to win Israeli election, exit polls show -- Al JazeeraÂ Israel election: Netanyahu may be able to build coalition with far-right allies, exit polls suggest -- The Guardian

entry.title: Brazilian President Bolsonaro Declines To Concede The Election To Lula da Silva But Orders The Transition To Begin
entry.summary: Daily Mail: Brazilian President Bolsonaro avoids saying he concedes defeat in first speech since losing election to leftist Lula - but his chief of staff says transition to new government will beginÂ * In a national address that lasted just a few minutes, Bolsonaro thanked BraziliansÂ * He didn't mention election results but reiterated he would follow the constitutionÂ * He said protests since then were the fruit of 'indignation and a sense of injustice'Â Brazil's far-right President Jair Bolsonaro failed to concede defeat to leftist Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in his first public remarks since losing Sunday's election.Â In a national address on Tuesday that lasted just a few minutes, Bolsonaro thanked Brazilians who voted for him.Â He didn't mention election results, but reiterated that he would follow the country's constitution, which stipulates a transition of power on January 1. Â Read more .... entry.title: Saudi Arabia And U.S. On High Alert After Intelligence Warning of Imminent Iranian Attack
entry.summary: The Iranian military displays missles at Tehranâ€™s Baharestan square to commemorate the 1980-88 Iran-Iraq war during â€œsacred defense weekâ€ September 25, 2003. (Morteza Nikoubazl/Reuters) Â FOX News: US, Saudi Arabia on high alert over intel of impending Iranian attack: reportÂ Planned strikes are believed to be targeting Saudi Arabia and IraqÂ The United States and Saudi Arabia are on high alert after Saudi intelligence shared with the U.S. indicated that Iran is expected to carry out an attack on targets in Saudi Arabia, the Wall Street Journal reported.Â Officials from both countries reportedly told the Journal about the concern over coming attacks. Saudi officials said that in addition to Saudi Arabia, Iran is also looking to strike Erbil, Iraq, where U.S. troops are located.Â The planned attacks are said to be intended as a distraction from protests taking place in Iran against the Islamic nation's leadership.Â Read more ...Â WNU Editor: I follow Iran very closely. I have seen no uptick in military positioning or movement. I would be shocked if Iran does launch strikes against Saudi Arabia.Â All that I can say is let us pray that such a conflict does not happen. A major war in the Middle East will mean +$200 for a barrel of oil coupled with widespread shortages and rationing. A collapse in supply chains and the global economy. A severe recession, or more likely a severe depression with massive unemployment and social unrest.Â Saudi Arabia And U.S. On High Alert After Intelligence Warning Of Imminent Iranian Attack Â U.S. concerned about Iranian threats to Saudi Arabia -- Reuters Â Pentagon â€˜Concernedâ€™ About Indications of Imminent Attack by Iran -- US News and World Report Â US officials warned of â€˜imminentâ€™ Iranian effort to strike Saudi Arabia, report says -- The Independent Â US on alert over â€˜imminentâ€™ Iran attack on Saudi Arabia, Iraq: report -- NYPostÂ Saudi Arabia, U.S., Raise Military Alert Levels over Fears of Iranian Attack -- National Review

entry.title: Developing Countries Need Monetary Financing
entry.summary:
SYDNEY and DAKAR, Nov 01 (IPS) - Developing countries have long been told to avoid borrowing from central banks (CBs) to finance government spending. Many have even legislated against CB financing of fiscal expenditure.

Central bank fiscal financing Such laws are supposedly needed to curb inflation â€“ below 5%, if not 2% â€“ to accelerate growth. These arrangements have also constrained a potential CB developmental role and government ability to respond better to crises.

Read the full story, â€œDeveloping Countries Need Monetary Financingâ€, on globalissues.org â†’

entry.title: Did All U.S. Military Planes Turn-Off Their Transponders Early Monday Morning?
entry.summary: WNU Editor: A lot of talk in alternative media that US military planes turned off their transponders early Monday morning (link here).Â I do not know if these reports are true. Main stream media is not reporting this story. Neither any of the military blogs that I follow.Â My gut tells me that if it did happen it was a test/exercise.Â Shutting down military transponders is what will happen if war breaks out between the U.S. and Russia. In this case it looks like someone wanted to test the reaction time.

entry.title: Leaked Documents Outline US Homeland Security's Plan To Work With Big Tech To Censor Social Media
entry.summary: The Intercept: Truth Cops Â Leaked Documents Outline DHSâ€™s Plans to Police DisinformationÂ The Department of Homeland Security is quietly broadening its efforts to curb speech it considers dangerous, an investigation by The Intercept has found.Â Years of internal DHS memos, emails, and documents â€” obtained via leaks and an ongoing lawsuit, as well as public documents â€” illustrate an expansive effort by the agency to influence tech platforms.Â The work, much of which remains unknown to the American public, came into clearer view earlier this year when DHS announced a new â€œDisinformation Governance Boardâ€: a panel designed to police misinformation (false information spread unintentionally), disinformation (false information spread intentionally), and malinformation (factual information shared, typically out of context, with harmful intent) that allegedly threatens U.S. interests.Â While the board was widely ridiculed, immediately scaled back, and then shut down within a few months, other initiatives are underway as DHS pivots to monitoring social media now that its original mandate â€” the war on terror â€” has been wound down. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: Sighhh .... another indication on how powerful the National Security establishment has become in the US..

entry.title: The economy is â€˜swirlingâ€™: Texans discuss their key election issues before the midterms
entry.summary:
Around 3 million Texans have already cast their vote in next week's midterm elections.
The southern state hosts several interesting contests - including for the Governorship - as Democrat and failed presidential candidate Beto O'Rourke tries to oust Republican Greg Abbott.
With the midterm elections approaching quickly, more and more Americans are talking about the issue of cost of living.
Sky News spoke to Texans to discuss their key election issues as Americans gear up to head to the polls for the midterms, with some pointing to the cost of living crisis, gun laws, and abortion rights.

entry.title: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi Tells US Secretary Of State Blinken That The U.S. Should Stop Trying To Suppress China
entry.summary: In this Sept. 23, 2022, file photo, U.S. Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken (left) meets with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on the margins of the 77th Session of the United Nations General Assembly High Level Week, in New York City. Credit: U.S. State Department photo Â The Diplomat: Blinken, Wang Have First China-US Talks Since 20th Party CongressÂ Chinese foreign minister stressed to his U.S. counterpart that Washington should not expect Beijing to change course.Â Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken talked on the phone on Monday. It was their first conversation â€” and the first high-level China-U.S. exchange â€” since the 20th National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) concluded on October 22.Â At the party meeting, Wang was elevated to the partyâ€™s Politburo. That indicates he is to replace outgoing Yang Jiechi as Chinaâ€™s top diplomat â€“ formally, the director of the Office of the Central Commission for Foreign Affairs, the CCPâ€™s foreign policy body. Wang will move out of his foreign minister post along with the promotion.Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: This meeting did not go well. entry.title: Ukraine Claims To Have Killed 1,000 Russian Soldeirs On Sunday
entry.summary:
Daily Mail: Russia 'suffers deadliest day of invasion yet with nearly a THOUSAND troops killed' as video shows panic-stricken soldiers fleeing on armoured vehicle which flips as it speeds away from Ukrainian attackÂ * Ukraine has claimed that 950 Russian soldiers were killed on Sunday as its forces continue to make gainsÂ * It marks the deadliest day for Vladimir Putin's troops since Russia's the invasion began in back in FebruaryÂ * Footage has emerged showing panicked soldiers fleeing attack on armoured vehicle - only for it to flip overÂ * Comes as Russia tries to round up as many men as possible and push them to the front lines, regardless of skillÂ Nearly 1,000 Russian soldiers have been killed in one day in Ukraine, Kyiv has claimed, marking the deadliest day for Vladimir Putin since his troops invaded eight months ago. Ukrainian forces have been making gains across Russian-occupied areas, with fighting intensifying in the country's east and in the southern city of Kherson.Â Â In a blow to Putin's invasion, 950 Russian soldiers were killed on Sunday, pushing the Russian death toll up to at least 71,200, Kyiv has claimed.Â Read more .... Â WNU editor: If you want to follow war reports from the Ukraine Ministry of Defense, the link is here (link here)
I personally follow their reports everyday. But needless to say I am skeptical. And in the past few weeks I have found their reports very hard to believe like the claim that 1,000 Russian soldiers were killed yesterday. But they are a reference tool that all those who are following the war should check out each day.Â As for those who want to follow the Russian Ministry of Defense website. It is unfortunately blocked for outsiders. This may change in the future, so the link is here https://eng.mil.ru/

entry.title: Remember the story behind Princess Diana's revenge dress?
entry.summary: The summer of 1994 was uncharacteristically warm for Great Britain. Hot, sunny days were followed by close, sticky nights â€” and by the end of June, pressure had started to build. The last week of the month was an explosive one, meteorologically and culturally. On Friday June 24, an exceptionally severe thunderstorm hit the south east of the UK, diffusing so much grass pollen it triggered a sudden and short-lived asthma epidemic. Two days later, and after years of mounting speculation, the British press broke the news that Prince Charles had accidentally revealed his unfaithfulness to Princess Diana during an ITN documentary. (When asked if he had stayed loyal to his wife, the Prince of Wales nodded. "Yes absolutely," he said before adding of his marriage "until it became irretrievably broken down.")

entry.title: Norway's Military On Raised Alert Level To Protect Energy Links In Response To Ukraine War
entry.summary: Norway raises military readiness amid Ukraine war, says PM https://t.co/S5yF1ab6pf via @YouTube â€” War News Updates (@WarNewsUpdates) October 31, 2022 DW: Norway raises army alert level in response to Ukraine warÂ The Norwegian armed forces will do less training and more active operations, the country's prime minister said. Oslo is concerned about sabotage to its energy infrastructure.Â Norway's Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Stoere said on Monday that his country's military would be put on a raised level of alert as part of increased security measures in response to the war in Ukraine.Â "This is the most severe security situation in several decades," Stoere told a press conference " There are no indications that Russia is expanding its warfare to other countries, but the increased tensions make us more exposed to threats, intelligence operations and influence campaigns."Â The increased alert level would be valid from Tuesday. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: I am surprised that it has taken Norway this long to raise its alert level. Everyone else in Europe is on high alert.Â Norway's Military On Raised Alert Level To Protect Energy Links In Response To Ukraine War Â Norway Armed Forces Raise Readiness to Protect Energy Links -- Bloomberg Â Norway raises military alert in response to Ukraine war -- Reuters Â Norway puts military on raised alert level in response to Ukraine war -- The Guardian Â Norway raises military alert level after suspicious drone sightings -- Euronews Â Norway puts military on raised alert over Ukraine war fears -- The National Â Norway raises the alert of its Armed Forces for possible attacks on strategic installations -- News 360

Tingshu Wang/Reuters Â Insider: Chinese leader Xi Jinping's power grab fueled a $6 trillion stock selloff and the yuan's decline. These 4 charts capture the market meltdownÂ * China's President Xi Jinping has tightened his grip on power â€” and that has rocked markets.Â * Investors dumped Chinese stocks in a $6 trillion blowout as Xi shut reformers out of decision making.Â * These 4 charts show how deep the meltdown in China-linked assets went last week.Â China's leader Xi Jinping has tightened his grip on power, shutting out reformers to effectively take sole charge of the world's second-largest economy â€” and that has rocked markets.Â President Xi unveiled a new decision-making team stacked with like-minded political allies and publicly disrespected his business-friendly predecessor at the Communist Party congress last week.Â Spooked investors dumped Chinese stocks in a $6 trillion blowout Monday, according to Bloomberg data. Meanwhile, the tightly-managed onshore yuan continued to lose ground to the dollar, having already dropped sharply this year. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: The expectation is for more stock market declines .... Rethinking China: Xi's Power Play Could Bring Down Stocks Even More (Barrons).Â More News On China's Stock Market Declines Â Xi's $6 Trillion Rout Shows China Markets Serve the Party First -- Bloomberg China stocks reel after Xi tightens grip -- Nikkei Asia Â China Stocks in Hong Kong Set for Lowest Since 2005 as Covid Zero Ramps Up -- Bloomberg

entry.title: EU Considering Listing Iranâ€™s Revolutionary Guards As A Terror Group
entry.summary: FILE PHOTO: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock speaks during a conference of her counterparts from the six Western Balkans countries, plus those from Austria, Bulgaria, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Greece and Slovenia, in Berlin, Germany, October 21, 2022. REUTERS/Christian Mang Â Reuters: EU examines classifying Iran Revolutionary Guards as terrorists - GermanyÂ BERLIN (Reuters) - Germany and the European Union are examining whether to classify Iran's Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation, Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said on Sunday.Â "I made it clear last week that we will launch another package of sanctions, that we will examine how we can also list the Revolutionary Guards as a terrorist organisation," Baerbock said in a interview with ARD broadcaster on Sunday.Â Her comments come after the head of the Revolutionary Guards warned protesters that Saturday would be their last day of taking to the streets, in a sign that security forces may intensify their already fierce crackdown on widespread unrest. Â Read more .... Â Update #1: EU considering listing Iranâ€™s Revolutionary Guards as terror group, says Berlin -- Times Of Israel/AFP Â Update #2: European Union Mulling Move to List Iran's Revolutionary Guards as Terrorists: Report -- News 18 Â WNU Editor: Iran is responding to these reports .... entry.title: Israelis Go To The Polls Tomorrow To Elect A New Government
entry.summary: Jerusalem Post: Israel elections: Politicians enter final preparations as voting day nearsÂ Labor on Saturday night held a rally in memory of former Labor leader and prime minister Yizhak Rabin, who was assassinated on November 4, 1995.Â Politicians and political candidates began to wrap up their campaigns and preparations over the weekend ahead of Tuesday's election. Â In accordance with Israeli law, no more polls will be published until the exit polls begin at 10 p.m. on Tuesday evening.Â Â On Saturday, Meretz and Hadash Taâ€™al continued their strategy of calling people to vote for them so they wonâ€™t fall under the electoral threshold, known colloquially as â€œgevaltâ€ campaigns.Â Read more .... entry.title: Is Facebook's Monopoly On Social Media About To End?
entry.summary: VICE: Facebookâ€™s Monopoly Is Imploding Before Our EyesÂ Competition, miscalculations, and regulatory scrutiny have all but killed the advertising giant's dreams of diversifying its business and rolling up the digital world into its platform.Â For years, the definition of success for many tech employees has been getting a job at a FAANG company (Facebook, Amazon, Apple, Netflix, Google).Â Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Facebook, and Google, meanwhile, are often the five major companies people think of when they think of "big tech."Â But there is evidence that Facebookâ€”once a dominant monopoly rightly blamed for all sorts of societal illsâ€”is on the precipice of dropping out of this group through years of sheer mismanagement, a failure to innovate, setting money on fire in pursuit of a metaverse that seemingly no one wants, a vulnerable business model that Apple is squarely taking aim at, and upstart competitors like TikTok that the company seemingly has no answer for. What seemed impossible just a year or two agoâ€”that Facebook will become just another tech company, more or lessâ€”now seems like a very real possibility. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: It has been quite a sight to see how quickly this social media platform has lost its influence and reach in the past year. And much of what has happened has been self-inflicted.Â And while I do believe Facebook will be with us for the foreseeable future. Alternative media platforms are now online, and they are providing an environment that does not have the censorship and privacy issues that Facebook has.

entry.title: Russia's Exit From Ukraine Grain Deal Puts World Food Supplies At Risk
entry.summary: FILE PHOTO: The Sierra Leone-flagged cargo ship Razoni, carrying Ukrainian grain, is seen in the Black Sea off Kilyos, near Istanbul Reuters: World food supplies at risk as Russia withdraws from Black Sea dealÂ SINGAPORE (Reuters) -Russia's weekend backtrack from a U.N.-brokered deal to export Black Sea grains is likely to hit shipments to import-dependent countries, deepening a global food crisis and sparking gains in prices.Â Hundreds of thousands of tonnes of wheat booked for delivery to Africa and the Middle East are at risk following Russia's withdrawal, while Ukrainian corn exports to Europe will get knocked lower, two Singapore-based traders said.Â Russia on Saturday suspended participation in the U.N. grain deal for an "indefinite term", after what it said was a major Ukrainian droâ€¦

entry.title: Russian Foreign Minister Draws Parallels Between The Ukraine War And The Cuban Missile Crisis
entry.summary: Lavrov says he hopes US President Joe Biden has the wisdom to deal with a global confrontation similar to the 1962 Cuban missile crisis, in reference to Moscow's war on Ukraine [File: Evgenia Novozhenina via AFP] Â Al Jazeera: Lavrov draws parallels between Ukraine war, Cuban missile crisis Â Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov says there are â€˜similaritiesâ€™ to the Cuban crisis, mainly because Russia is now threatened by Western weapons in Ukraine.Â Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said he hopes US President Joe Biden has the wisdom to deal with a global confrontation similar to the 1962 Cuban missile crisis, referencing the war on Ukraine.Â Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine has triggered the biggest hostilities between Moscow and the West since the Cuban crisis, when the Soviet Union and United States came close to a nuclear war. Â Read more .... Â Update: Russia's Lavrov needles Biden over Cuban missile crisis and Ukraine (Reuters). Â WNU Editor: I remember my father telling me that during the Cuban missile crisis he was certain that there would be a nuclear war between the USSR and the United States.Â We are not there yet. But the trend lines are very worrisome on where this current conflict is heading.

entry.title: U.S. To Deploy Nuclear-Capable B-52 Bombers To Australia's North
entry.summary: ABC News Australia: US Air Force to deploy nuclear-capable B-52 bombers to Australia as tensions with China growÂ The United States is preparing to deploy up to six nuclear-capable B-52 bombers to northern Australia, a provocative move experts say is aimed squarely at China.Â An investigation by Four Corners can reveal Washington is planning to build dedicated facilities for the giant aircraft at Tindal air base, south of Darwin.Â The US has drawn up detailed plans for what it calls a "squadron operations facility" for use during the Northern Territory dry season, an adjoining maintenance centre and a parking area for "six B-52s". Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: This is aimed at China, and Beijing has no illusions on what the US is doing. Update: Yup. A big bullseye .... Why the United States' big plan to deploy huge nuclear bombers to the Northern Territory is going to put a 'bullseye' on Australia as tensions with China rise (Daily Mail).Â U.S. To Deploy Nuclear-Capable B-52 Bombers To Australia's North Â U.S. plans to deploy B-52 bombers to Australia's north -source -- Reuters Â US Building Facility to Base B-52 Bombers in Australia, ABC Says -- Bloomberg Â US to send B-52 bombers to Australia in HUGE move against China -- Yahoo NewsÂ US plans to deploy B-52 bombers to northern Australia: Report -- Al Jazeera

entry.title: In Her Final Days As UK Prime Minister Liz Truss It Is Reported That She Spent Her Final Days In Office In Fear Of A Russian Nuclear Attack
entry.summary: Liz Truss reportedly spend her final days in office in fear of a nuclear attack. Picture: Alamy Â Daily Mail: Liz Truss's Putin radiation terror: Ex-PM spent final days in No10 'obsessing' with wind charts and weather forecasts as her fears grew that fallout would hit UK if Putin uses nukes in Ukraine, new look inside her doomed tenure revealsÂ * Truss was told Putin might explode a weapon in the air above the Black SeaÂ * Radiation could pose threat to Europe if weapon blew in the directionÂ * Ms Truss became fixated with the weather after hearing about possibilityÂ When Liz Truss was told, during the dying days of her mayfly Premiership, that the security services were picking up intelligence that Vladimir Putin might use a tactical nuclear weapon in Ukraine it sent a chill down her spine.Â The Prime Minister was still adjusting to getting used to a new mobile phone number, for the first time in over a decade, as a result of a hack suspected to have been backed or orchestrated by the Kremlin, potentially giving Putin access to information about Western support for President Volodymyr Zelensky's regime.Â Â In particular, Ms Truss was told that Putin might explode a weapon in the air above the Black Sea, which would show the West what he was capable of without triggering a full-scale nuclear war. Â Read more .... Â Update: Liz Truss 'obsessed with wind charts and weather forecasts because she feared nuclear fallout' in final days in office (LBC). Â WNU Editor: It looks like she blindly trusted her intelligence services. She should have been more skeptical.

entry.title: Majority Of Americans Say Putin Should Be Overthrown
entry.summary: Â© Gavriil Grigorov/POOL/TASS Â DNYUZ/Newsweek: Putin Should Be Overthrown, Majority of Americans Say: PollÂ A majority of American voters believe seeking to remove Russian President Vladimir Putin from power is a â€œreasonable objective,â€ according to a new survey conducted exclusively for Newsweek.Â On February 24 Putin ordered his army into Ukraine, triggering one of the biggest wars in Europe since the end of World War II.Â After the Russians initially made significant gains, Ukraine has recaptured some territory over the past couple of months, particularly around the northern city of Kharkiv and Kherson in the south.Â According to the Redfield and Wilton poll, conducted for Newsweek, 60 percent of U.S. voters think seeking to â€œremove Vladimir Putin from power would be a reasonable objective.â€ Â Read more .... entry.title: A Republican Landslide In The Midterms Next Week?
entry.summary: 2022 Generic Congressional Ballot Republicans 47% (+2) Democrats 45% â¦¿ Independents: 49R-33D (R+16) â¦¿ CBS News/YouGov | LV's | 10/26-28https://t.co/GFxk4fhzUD pic.twitter.com/E2TEK1truX â€” InteractivePolls (@IAPolls2022) October 30, 2022 CBS News: Republicans head into final week with lead in seats, voters feel things are "out of control" â€” CBS News Battleground Tracker pollÂ The election is already underway; millions have voted, and tens of millions more will before Nov. 8. Amid that, eight in 10 likely voters describe things in the country today as "out of control," as opposed to "under control."Â That doesn't bode well for the party in power: Republicans are winning those who say "out of control" right now by more than 20 points, though they're often the ones feeling that way to begin with. So where do things stand? Â Read more .... Â Update #1: The US Senate races appear to be close .... Its a dead heat for the US Senate (FiveThirtyEight). Â Update #2: It looks like some Governor-ships are flipping Republican .... Governorâ€™s Races Enter Final Sprint on a Scrambled, Surprising Map (New York Times). Â WNU Editor: The CBS/YouGov poll does not say how much of their sample size is Democrat/Republican/Independent.Â FiveThirtyEight says it is a dead heat, but when you look at their map projections it looks like the Republicans are going to pick up a minimum of two seats.Â The New York Times assessment on the governor-ships is blunt. A number of Republican pick-ups. Bottom line. It is going to be a good night if you are a Republican.

entry.title: Taiwan Needs US Weapons
entry.summary:
In this photo released by the Taiwan Ministry of National Defense, Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen watches soldiers operate equipment during a visit to a naval station on Penghu, an archipelago of several dozen islands off Taiwan's western coast on Tuesday, Aug. 30, 2022. (Taiwan Ministry of National Defense via AP) Â StraitArrowNews: Taiwan canâ€™t fend off China without US weaponsÂ Since the start of Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine, the United States sent hundreds of millions of dollarsâ€™ worth of weaponry to the Ukrainians. Things like Javelin anti-tank missiles and HIMARS rockets. Now, as China seems poised to launch an invasion of Taiwan, some are concerned that the U.S. might not have enough weapons to help the self-governing island defend itself.Â Defending Taiwan is a vastly different undertaking from U.S. efforts with Ukraine. Unlike in Ukraine, where Russia could assemble troops along the border before invading, the Chinese would have to cross 100 miles of open ocean to launch an assault. There hasnâ€™t been an amphibious assault on such a scale since the Korean War.Â Preventing the Chinese from establishing a beachhead would be critical to defending the island. If the Chinese succeeded in establishing a footing and is able to transport troops and weapons to the island, the battle is probably over. Â Read more .... Â WNU Editor: Fortunately for Taiwan the Chinese military have a 100 mile ocean that they must cross to launch an assault. But the Chinese will succeed if the firepower is not there to stop them. Bottom line. The Taiwanese need weapons if they have any hope to persevere.
The same can be said about the Russia - Ukraine war. If Ukraine was not receiving US military aid, the military would have collapsed a long time ago, and the Zelensky government would have been forced to agree to peace terms dictated by Moscow.
